ai.summary: The Monmouth Rebellion Walk is a hard 273 km long-distance trail across the UK, offering a challenging trek that traces historical routes connected to the Monmouth Rebellion. The route spans varied landscapes, demanding good navigation, endurance, and careful planning.
ai.terrain_summary: Expect a mix of country lanes, hedgerows, river valleys, open moorland, and occasional town sections. Elevation can be substantial with long days of walking; footing ranges from well-made paths to muddy fields. Some sections may require crossing roads or engaging with private property.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for multi-day trekking across remote sections. Check weather and daylight hours; carry maps, compass, and a GPS backup. Stay hydrated and fueled with regular snacks; have an emergency plan and tell someone your itinerary. Be prepared for variable UK conditions, dress in layers, and respect local access rules.
recommended_gear: Sturdy waterproof hiking boots with good ankle support
Waterproof, breathable outer layer and warm mid-layers
Map and compass with GPS as backup
Water bottle or hydration system (2–3 L)
High-energy food and snacks for multi-day sections
First aid kit suitable for longer treks
Dry bag for electronics and valuables
ai.best_seasons: Spring and autumn are generally ideal for this UK route due to milder temperatures and reliable daylight; summer offers longer days but can be hot and exposed, while winter presents shorter daylight windows and tougher conditions.
